                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                DISCIPLINE OF PRISONERS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Separation of prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    27. The requisitions of this Act with respect to the separation of prisoners are as follows:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1) 	in a prison containing female as well as male prisoners, the females shall be imprisoned in separate buildings, or separate parts of the same building, in such manner as to prevent their seeing, or conversing or holding any intercourse with, the male prisoners:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	in a prison where male prisoners under the age of twenty-one are confined, means shall be provided for separating them altogether from the other prisoners and for separating those of them who have arrived at the age of puberty from those who have not:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	unconvicted criminal prisoners shall be kept apart from convicted criminal prisoners: and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	civil prisoners shall be kept apart from criminal prisoners.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Association and segregation of prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    28. Subject to the requirements of the last foregoing section, convicted criminal prisoners may be confined either in association or individually in cells or partly in one way and partly in the other.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Solitary confinement

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    29. No cell shall be used for solitary confinement unless it is furnished with the means of enabling the prisoner to communicate at any time with an officer or the prison, and every prisoner so confined in a cell for more than twenty-four hours, whether as a punishment or otherwise, shall be visited at least once a day by the Medical Officer or Medical Subordinate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Prisoners under sentence of death

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    30. (1) Every prisoner under sentence of death shall, immediately on his arrival in the prison after sentence, be searched by, or by order of, the Jailer and all articles shall be taken from him which the Jailer deems it dangerous or inexpedient to leave in his possession.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Every such prisoner shall be confined in a cell apart from all other prisoners, and shall be placed by day and by night under the charge of a guard. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VI

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                FOOD, CLOTHING AND BEDDING OF CIVIL AND UNCONVICTED CRIMINAL PRISONERS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Maintenance of certain prisoners from private sources

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    31. A civil prisoner or an unconvicted criminal prisoner shall be permitted to maintain himself, and to purchase, or receive from private sources at proper hours, food, clothing, bedding or other necessaries, but subject to examination and to such rules as may be approved by the Inspector General. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Restriction on transfer of food and clothing between certain prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    32. No part of any food, clothing, bedding or other necessaries belonging to any civil or unconvicted criminal prisoner shall be given, hired or sold to any other prisoner; and any prisoner transgressing the provisions of this section shall lose the privilege of purchasing food or receiving it from private sources, for such time as the Superintendent thinks proper. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Supply of clothing and bedding to civil and unconvicted criminal prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    33. (1) Every civil prisoner and unconvicted criminal prisoner unable to provide himself with sufficient clothing and bedding shall be supplied by the Superintendent with such clothing and bedding as may be necessary.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) When any civil prisoner has been committed to prison in execution of a decree in favour of a private person, such person, or his representative, shall, within forty-eight hours after the receipt by him of a demand in writing, pay to the Superintendent the cost of the clothing and bedding so supplied to the prisoner; and in default of such payment the prisoner may be released. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VII

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                EMPLOYMENT OF PRISONERS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Employment of civil prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    34. (1) Civil prisoners may, with the Superintendent's permission, work and follow any trade or profession.(2) Civil prisoners finding their own implements, and not maintained at the expense of the prison, shall be allowed to receive the whole of their earnings; but the earnings of such as are furnished with implements or are maintained at the expense of the prison shall be subject to a deduction, to be determined by the Superintendent, for the use of implements and the cost of maintenance. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Employment of criminal prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    35. (1) No criminal prisoner sentenced to labour or employed on labour at his own desire shall, except on an emergency with the sanction in writing of the Superintendent, be kept to labour for more than nine hours in any one day.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The Medical Officer shall from time to time examine the labouring prisoners while they are employed, and shall at least once in every fortnight cause to be recorded upon the history-ticket of each prisoner employed on labour the weight of such prisoner at the time.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) When the Medical Officer is of opinion that the health of any prisoner suffers from employment on any kind or class of labour, such prisoner shall not be employed on that labour but shall be placed on such other kind or class of labour as the Medical Officer may consider suited for him. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Employment of criminal prisoners sentenced to simple imprisonment

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    36. Provision shall be made by the Superintendent for the employment (as long as they so desire) of all criminal prisoners sentenced to simple imprisonment; but no prisoner not sentenced to rigorous imprisonment shall be punished for neglect of work excepting by such alteration in the scale of diet as may be established by the rules of the prison in the case of neglect of work by such a prisoner. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VIII

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                HEALTH OF PRISONERS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Sick prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    37. (1) The names of prisoners desiring to see the Medical Subordinate or appearing out of health in mind or body shall, without delay, be reported by the officer in immediate charge of such prisoners to the Jailer.(2) The Jailer shall, without delay, call the attention of the Medical Subordinate to any prisoners desiring to see him, or who is ill, or whose state of mind or body appears to require attention, and shall carry into effect all written directions given by the Medial Officer or Medical Subordinate respecting alterations of the discipline or treatment of any such prisoner. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Record of directions of Medical Officers

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    38. All directions given by the Medical Officer or Medical Subordinate in relation to any prisoner, with the exception of orders for the supply of medicines or directions relating to such matters as are carried into effect by the Medical Officer himself or under his superintendence, shall be entered day by day in the prisoner's history-ticket or in such other record as the Government may by rule direct, and the Jailer shall make an entry in its proper place stating in respect of each direction the fact of its having been or not having been complied with, accompanied by such observations, if any, as the Jailer thinks fit to make, and the date of the entry. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Hospital

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    39. In every prison an hospital or proper place for the reception of sick prisoners shall be provided. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter IX

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                VISITS TO PRISONERS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Visits to civil and unconvicted criminal prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    40. Due provision shall be made for the admission, at proper times and under proper restrictions, into every prison of persons with whom civil or unconvicted criminal prisoners may desire to communicate, care being taken that so far as may be consistent with the interests of justice, prisoners under trial may see their duly qualified legal advisers without the presence of any other person. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Search of visitors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    41. (1) The Jailer may demand the name and address of any visitor to a prisoner, and, when the Jailer has any ground for suspicion, may search any visitor, or cause him to be searched, but the search shall not be made in the presence of any prisoner or of another visitor.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) In case of any such visitor refusing to permit himself to be searched, the Jailer may deny him admission; and the grounds of such proceeding, with the particulars thereof, shall be entered in such record as the Government may direct. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter X

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OFFENCES IN RELATION TO PRISONS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Penalty for introduction or removal of prohibited articles into or from prison and communication with prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    42. Whoever, contrary to any rule under section 59 introduces or removes or attempts by any means whatever to introduce or remove, into or from any prison, or supplies or attempts to supply to any prisoner outside the limits of a prison, any prohibited article,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and every officer of a prison who, contrary to any such rule, knowingly suffers any such article to be introduced into or removed from any prison, to be possessed by any prisoner, or to be supplied to any prisoner outside the limits of a preson,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and whoever, contrary to any such rule, communicates or attempts to communicate with any prisoner,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and whoever abets any offence made punishable by this section,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall, on conviction before a Magistrate, be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months, or to fine not exceeding two hundred Taka or to both. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to arrest for offence under section 42

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    43. When any person, in the presence of any officer of a prison, commits any offence specified in the last foregoing section, and refuses on demand of such officer to state his name and residence, or gives a name of residence which such officer knows, or has reason to believe, to be false, such officer may arrest him, and shall without unnecessary delay make him over to a Police-officer, and thereupon such Police-officer shall proceed as if the offence had been committed in his presence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Publication of penalties

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    44. The Superintendent shall cause to be affixed, in a conspicuous place outside the prison, a notice in English and  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "in Bengali" were substituted, for the words "the vernacular" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >10</a></sup></span></span>[in Bengali] setting forth the acts prohibited under section 42 and the penalties incurred by their commission. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter XI

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRISON-OFFENCES

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Prison-offences

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    45. The following acts are declared to be prison-offences when committed by a prisoner:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	such wilful disobedience to any regulation of the prison as shall have been declared by rules made under section 59 to be a prison-offence;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	any assault or use of criminal force;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	the use of insulting or threatening language;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	immoral or indecent or disorderly behaviour;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5)	wilfully disabling himself from labour;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6)	contumaciously refusing to work;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7)	filing, cutting, altering or removing handcuffs, fetters or bars without due authority;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(8)	wilful idleness or negligence at work by any prisoner sentenced to rigorous imprisonment;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(9)	wilful mismanagement of work by any prisoner sentenced to rigorous imprisonment;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(10)	wilful damage to prison-property;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(11)	tampering with or defacing history-tickets, records or documents;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(12)	receiving, possessing or transferring any prohibited article;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(13)	feigning illness;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(14)	wilfully bringing a false accusation against any officer or prisoner;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(15)	omitting or refusing to report, as soon as it comes to his knowledge, the occurrence of any fire, any plot or conspiracy, and escape, attempt or preparation to escape, and any attack or preparation for attack upon any prisoner or prison-official; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(16)	conspiring to escape, or to assist in escaping or to commit any other of the offences aforesaid.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Punishment of such offences

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    46. The Superintendent may examine any person touching any such offence, and determine thereupon, and punish such offence by -		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1) a formal warning:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Explanation.-A formal warning shall mean a warning personally addressed to a prisoner by the Superintendent and recorded in the punishment-book and on the prisoner's history-ticket;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	change of labour to some more irksome or severe form for such period as may be prescribed by rules made by the Government;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	hard labour for a period not exceeding seven days in the case of convicted criminal prisoners not sentenced to rigorous imprisonment;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	such loss of privileges admissible under the remission system for the time being in force as may be prescribed by rules made by the Government;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5)	the substitution of gunny or other coarse fabric for clothing of other material, not being woollen, for a period which shall not exceed three months;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6)	imposition of handcuffs of such pattern and weight, in such manner and for such period, as may be prescribed by rules made by the Government;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7)	imposition of fetters of such pattern and weight, in such manner and for such period, as may be prescribed by rules made by the Government;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(8)	separate confinement for any period not exceeding three months:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Explanation.-Separate confinement means such confinement with or without labour as secludes a prisoner from communication with, but not from sight of, other prisoners, and allows him not less than one hour's exercise per diem and to have his meals in association with one or more other prisoners;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(9)	penal diet,- that is, restriction of diet in such manner and subject to such conditions regarding labour as may be prescribed by the Government:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that such restriction of diet shall in no case be applied to a prisoner for more than ninety-six consecutive hours, and shall not be repeated except for a fresh offence not until after an interval of one week;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(10)	cellular confinement for any period not exceeding fourteen days:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that after each period of cellular confinement an interval of not less duration than such period must elapse before the prisoner is again sentenced to cellular or solitary confinement:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Explanation.-Cellular confinement means such confinement with or without labour as entirely secludes a prisoner from communication with, but not from sight of, other prisoners;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(11) 	penal diet as defined in clause (9) combined with cellular confinement;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(12) 	whipping, provided that the number of stripes shall not exceed thirty:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that nothing in this section shall render any female or civil prisoner liable to the imposition of any form of handcuffs or fetters, or to whipping.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Plurality of punishments under section 46

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    47. (1) Any two of the punishments enumerated in the last foregoing section may be awarded for any such offence in combination, subject to the following exceptions, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	formal warning shall not be combined with any other punishment except loss of privileges under clause (4) of that section;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	penal diet shall not be combined with change of labour under clause (2) of that section, nor shall any additional period of penal diet awarded singly be combined with any period of penal diet awarded in combination with cellular confinement;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	cellular confinement shall not be combined with separate confinement, so as to prolong the total period of seclusion to which the prisoner shall be liable;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	whipping shall not be combined with any other form of punishment except cellular and separate confinement and loss of privileges admissible under the remission system;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5)	no punishment will be combined with any other punishment in contravention of rules made by the Government.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) No punishment shall be awarded for any such offence so as to combine, with the punishment awarded for any other such offence, two of the punishments which may not be awarded in combination for any such offence.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Award of punishments under sections 46 and 47

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    48. (1) The Superintendent shall have power to award any of the punishments enumerated in the two last foregoing sections, subject, in the case of separate confinement for a period exceeding one month, to the previous confirmation of the Inspector General.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) No officer subordinate to the Superintendent shall have power to award any punishment whatever. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Punishments to be in accordance with foregoing sections

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    49. Except by order of a Court of Justice, no punishment other than the punishments specified in the foregoing sections shall be inflicted on any prisoner, and no punishment shall be inflicted on any prisoner otherwise than in accordance with the provisions of those sections. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Medical Officer to certify to fitness of prisoner for punishment

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    50. (1) No punishment of penal diet, either singly or in combination, or of whipping, or of change of labour under section 46, clause (2), shall be executed until the prisoner to whom such punishment has been awarded has been examined by the Medical Officer, who, if he considers the prisoner fit to undergo the punishment, shall certify accordingly in the appropriate column of the punishment-book prescribed in section 12.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) If he considers the prisoner unfit to undergo the punishment, he shall in like manner record his opinion in writing and shall state whether the prisoner is absolutely unfit for punishment of the kind awarded, or whether he considers any modification necessary.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) In the latter case he shall state what extent of punishment he thinks the prisoner can undergo without injury to his health. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Entries in punishment-book

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    51. (1) In the punishment-book prescribed in section 12 there shall be recorded, in respect of every punishment inflicted, the prisoner's name, register number and the class (whether habitual or not ) to which he belongs, the prison-offence of which he was guilty, the date on which such prison-offence was committed, the number of previous prison-offences recorded against the prisoner, and the date of his last prison-offence, the punishment awarded, and the date of infliction.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) In the case of every serious prison-offence, the names of the witnesses proving the offence shall be recorded, and, in the case of offences for which whipping is awarded, the Superintendent shall record the substance of the evidence of the witnesses, the defence of the prisoner, and the finding with the reasons therefor.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Against the entries relating to each punishment the Jailer and Superintendent shall affix their initials as evidence of the correctness of the entries. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Procedure on committal of heinous offence

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    52. If any prisoner is guilty of any offence against prison-discipline which, by reason of his having frequently committed such offences or otherwise, in the opinion of the Superintendent, is not adequately punishable by the infliction of any punishment which he has power under this Act to award, the Superintendent may forward such prisoner to the Court of the District Magistrate or of any Magistrate of the first class having jurisdiction, together with a statement of the circumstances, and such Magistrate shall thereupon inquire into and try the charge so brought against the prisoner, and, upon conviction, may sentence him to imprisonment which may extend to one year, such term to be in addition to any term for which such prisoner was undergoing imprisonment when he committed such offence, or may sentence him to any of the punishments enumerated in section 46:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that any such case may be transferred for inquiry and trial by the District Magistrate to any Magistrate of the first class: and<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided also that no person shall be punished twice for the same offence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Whipping

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    53. (1) No punishment of whipping shall be inflicted in installments, or except in the presence of the Superintendent and Medical Officer or Medical Subordinate.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Whipping shall be inflicted with a light ratan not less than half an inch in diameter on the buttocks, and in case of prisoners under the age of sixteen it shall be inflicted, in the way of school discipline, with a lighter ratan. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Offences by prison subordinates

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    54. (1) Every Jailer or officer of a prison subordinate to him who shall be guilty of any violation of duty or wilful breach or neglect of any rule or regulation or lawful order made by competent authority, or who shall withdraw from the duties of his office without permission, or without having given previous notice in writing of his intention for the period of two months, or who shall wilfully overstay any leave granted to him, or who shall engage without authority in any employment other than his prison-duty, or who shall be guilty of cowardice, shall be liable, on conviction before a Magistrate, to fine not exceeding two hundred Taka, or to imprisonment for a period not exceeding three months, or to both.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) No person shall under this section be punished twice for the same offence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter XII

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                MISCELLANEOUS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Extramural custody, control and employment of prisoners

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	55. A prisoner, when being taken to or from any prison in which he may be lawfully confined, or whenever he is working outside or is otherwise beyond the limits of any such prison in or under the lawful custody or control of a prison-officer belonging to such prison, shall be deemed to be in prison and shall be subject to all the same incidents as if he were actually in prison. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Confinement in irons

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	56. Whenever the Superintendent considers it necessary (with reference either to the state of the prison or the character of the prisoners) for the safe custody of any prisoners that they should be confined in irons, he may, subject to such rules and instructions as may be laid down by the Inspector General with the sanction of the Government, so confine them. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Confinement of prisoners under sentence of transportation in irons

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	57. (1) Prisoners under sentence of transportation may, subject to any rules made under section 59, be confined in fetters for the first three months after admission to prison.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Should the Superintendent consider it necessary, either for the safe custody of the prisoner himself or for any other reason, that fetters should be retained on any such prisoner for more than three months, he shall apply to the Inspector General for sanction to their retention for the period for which he considers their retention necessary, and the Inspector General may sanction such retention accordingly. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Prisoners not to be ironed by Jailer except under necessity

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    58. No prisoner shall be put in irons or under mechanical restraint by the Jailer of his own authority, except in case of urgent necessity, in which case notice thereof shall be forthwith given to the Superintendent. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to make rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    59. The Government may make rules consistent with this Act-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	defining the acts which shall constitute prison-offences;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	determining the classification of prison-offences into serious and minor offences;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	fixing the punishments admissible under this Act which shall be awardable for commission of prison-offences or classes thereof;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	declaring the circumstances in which acts constituting both a prison-offence and an offence under the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >11</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code] may or may not be dealt with as a prison-offence;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5)	for the award of marks and the shortening of sentences;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6)	regulating the use of arms against any prisoner or body of prisoners in the case of an outbreak or attempt to escape;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7)	defining the circumstances and regulating the conditions under which prisoners in danger of death may be released;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(8)	for the classification of prisons, and description and construction of wards, cells and other places of detention;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(9)	for the regulation by numbers, length or character of sentences, or otherwise, of the prisoners to be confined in each class of prisons;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(10)	for the government of prisons and for the appointment of all officers appointed under this Act;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(11)	as to the food, bedding and clothing of criminal prisoners and of civil prisoners maintained otherwise than at their own cost;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(12)	for the employment, instruction and control of convicts within or without prisons;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(13)	for defining articles the introduction or removal of which into or out of prisons without due authority is prohibited;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(14)	for classifying and prescribing the forms of labour and regulating the periods of rest from labour;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(15)	for regulating the disposal of the proceeds of the employment of prisoners;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(16)	for regulating the confinement in fetters of prisoners sentenced to transportation;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(17)	for the classification and the separation of prisoners;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(18)	for regulating the confinement of convicted criminal prisoners under section 28;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(19)	for the preparation and maintenance of history-tickets;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(20)	for the selection and appointment of prisoners as officers of prisons;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(21)	for rewards for good conduct;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(22)	for regulating the transfer of prisoners whose term of transportation or imprisonment is about to expire 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='The words and commas "subject, however, to the consent of the Provincial Government of any other province to which a prisoner is to be transferred" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >12</a></sup></span></span>[* * *];	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(23)	for the treatment, transfer and disposal of criminal lunatics or recovered criminal lunatics confined in prisons;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(24)	for regulating the transmission of appeals and petitions from prisoners and their communications with their friends;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(25)	for the appointment and guidance of visitors of prisons;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(26)	for extending any or all the provisions of this Act and of the rules thereunder to subsidiary jails or special places of confinement appointed under section 541 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, commas and figure "Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898," were substituted, for the words, commas and figure "Code of Criminal Procedure, 1882," by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >13</a></sup></span></span>[<a title='Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898' href='/act-75.html'>Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898</a>,] and to the officers employed, and the prisoners confined, therein;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(27)	in regard to the admission, custody, employment, dieting, treatment and release of prisoners; and 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(28)	generally for carrying into effect the purposes of this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    60. [Repealed  by the Government of India (Adaptation of Indian Laws) Order, 1937.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exhibition of copies of rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    61. Copies of rules, under section 59 so far as they affect the government of prisons, shall be exhibited, both in English and in  <span class='footnote'  title='The word "Bengali" was substituted, for the words "the vernacular" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >14</a></sup></span></span>[Bengali], in some place to which all persons employed within a prison have access. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exercise of powers of Superintendent and Medical Officer

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    62. All or any of the powers and duties conferred and imposed by this Act on a Superintendent or Medical Officer may in his absence be exercised and performed by such other officer as the Government may appoint in this behalf either by name or by his official designation. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
